title: Finding the Domain
text: The original function $$f(x)={\left(x-4\right)}^2$$ is not one-to-one, but the function is restricted to a domain of $$x \leq 4$$ on which it is one-to-one.

title: Finding the Inverse
text:
The general procedure for finding an inverse is to:
1) Replace f(x) with $$y$$.
2) Interchange $$x$$ and $$y$$.
3) Solve for $$y$$, and rename the function $$f^{-1\left(xight)}$$

title: Domain
text: The domain of the original function was restricted to $$x \leq 4$$, so the outputs of the inverse need to be the same, i.e. $$f^{-1\left(x\right)} \leq 4$$.

title: Domain
text: Which of the inverse would let us satisfy the initial domain of $$x \leq 4$$, i.e. for all $$x$$ in the domain of $$f^{-1\left(x\right)}$$, $$f^{-1\left(x\right)} \leq 4$$? Note that $$\sqrt{x}$$ is always greater than or equal to $$0$$.
